page.title: 01The Aire Valley Landscapes
page.content: Our area contains both urban and rural landscapes. The town of Bingley is situated in a valley which is the main roadway to the Yorkshire Dales. The town has a good shopping area, pleasant houses and old mill buildings which are now used for other commercial interests. A few minutes drive from the centre of Bingley brings you into local villages which are surrounded by woodland, parks and moorland. There are many old buildings of historical and architectural interest for the visitor. The river Aire runs through one side of the valley alongside the main road and railway. While at the other side we have the Leeds and Liverpool canal with its famous Five Rise Locks. It is a very enjoyable and interesting place to live.
